attributes.comment:
My husband and I are VERY UPSET about this "Notice of Proposed Rule
Making" in the Federal Register that would substantially raise filing
fees for most types of cases. If the proposed rule is adopted,
filing fees would increase by an average of 66% over current fees.

We are just beginning to start the adoption process. Do you realize it is
anywhere from $20,000-$35,000 CASH UPFRONT to adopt a child? We are
already struggling to come up with that kind of cash. Increasing it would only
hurt and hinder those couples and single parents who wish to give a poor,
unwanted child a loving home. Adoption is expensive enough already, and it is
unconscionable to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions.

PLEASE DON'T DO THIS! Ultimately you will be affecting hundreds and
thousands of children if you make it even more difficult for adoptive parents to
adopt.

Please have a heart and DON'T pass this proposal.
Thank you,
Mr. & Mrs. John & Tina Cowsert
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Tina Cowsert
